Food

items.title: Awesome Rtc
items.content_text:
### Server Software / Media Servers

*   [Jitsi](https://jitsi.org/projects) - A collection of RTC open source projects, with a focus on conferencing software.

### Operations / Monitoring

*   [WebRTC Troubleshooter (‚≠ê486)](https://github.com/webrtc/testrtc) - Self-hosted one stop client-side WebRTC troubleshooter.

### Operations / Testing

*   [sipexer (‚≠ê350)](https://github.com/miconda/sipexer) - Modern and flexible SIP command line tool.

### Operations / Deployment

*   [slimswitch (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/rtckit/slimswitch) - Tooling for creating lean secure FreeSWITCH Docker images.

### Operations / Web/API Interfaces

*   [Eqivo](https://eqivo.org) - Open source programmable-voice/telephony API platform.
*   [Fonoster (‚≠ê6.7k)](https://github.com/fonoster/fonoster) - Telecommunication stack built with Node.js.
*   [Wazo](https://wazo-platform.org) - VoIP API platform built on top of Asterisk, Kamailio and RTPEngine.
*   [jambonz](https://www.jambonz.org) - Open source CPaaS built for communications service providers.
*   [IVOZ Provider (‚≠ê208)](https://github.com/irontec/ivozprovider) - Multitenant solution for VoIP telephony providers.

### Developer Resources / C/C++ Libraries

*   [Sofia-SIP (‚≠ê300)](https://github.com/freeswitch/sofia-sip) - Open source SIP library used by FreeSWITCH.

### Events / Dart Libraries

*   [CommCon](https://commcon.xyz) - Annual conference held in the UK focused on telecommunications in general and WebRTC in particular.
*   [FOSDEM](https://fosdem.org) - Free event for software developers, with a RTC component, held every year in Europe.
*   [JanusCon](https://www.januscon.it) - JanusCon is a live event for Janus and RTC implementers.
*   [TADHack](https://tadhack.com) - Global hackathon focused on programmable communications.

### Related Lists / Dart Libraries

*   [SIP Resources (‚≠ê231)](https://github.com/miconda/sip-resources) - Useful SIP resources curated by Kamailio's head developer.
items.content_html:

Operations / Testing

  • sipexer (‚≠ê350) - Modern and flexible SIP command line tool.

Operations / Deployment

Operations / Web/API Interfaces

  • Eqivo - Open source programmable-voice/telephony API platform.
  • Fonoster (‚≠ê6.7k) - Telecommunication stack built with Node.js.
  • Wazo - VoIP API platform built on top of Asterisk, Kamailio and RTPEngine.
  • jambonz - Open source CPaaS built for communications service providers.
  • IVOZ Provider (‚≠ê208) - Multitenant solution for VoIP telephony providers.

Developer Resources / C/C++ Libraries

  • Sofia-SIP (‚≠ê300) - Open source SIP library used by FreeSWITCH.

Events / Dart Libraries

  • CommCon - Annual conference held in the UK focused on telecommunications in general and WebRTC in particular.
  • FOSDEM - Free event for software developers, with a RTC component, held every year in Europe.
  • JanusCon - JanusCon is a live event for Janus and RTC implementers.
  • TADHack - Global hackathon focused on programmable communications.

Related Lists / Dart Libraries

  • SIP Resources (‚≠ê231) - Useful SIP resources curated by Kamailio's head developer.

items.title: Awesome Fiber
items.content_text:
### ‚öôÔ∏è Middlewares / üå± Third Party

*   [shareed2k/fiber\_tracing (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/shareed2k/fiber_tracing) - Middleware trace requests on Fiber framework with OpenTracing API.
*   [ansrivas/fiberprometheus (‚≠ê199)](https://github.com/ansrivas/fiberprometheus) - Prometheus middleware for gofiber.
*   [sacsand/gofiber-firebaseauth (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/sacsand/gofiber-firebaseauth) - Fiber Firebase Auth Middleware.
*   [aschenmaker/fiber-health-check (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/aschenmaker/fiber-health-check) - Health-check middleware support health-check for FiberÔ∏è framework.
*   [elastic/apmfiber (‚≠ê421)](https://github.com/elastic/apm-agent-go/tree/master/module/apmfiber) - APM Agent for Go Fiber.
*   [eozer/fiber\_ldapauth (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/eozer/fiber_ldapauth) - LDAP Authentication Middleware for Fiber.

### üöß Boilerplates / üå± Third Party

*   [gofiber/boilerplate (‚≠ê477)](https://github.com/gofiber/boilerplate) - Official fiber boilerplate.
*   [fiber-boilerplate (‚≠ê284)](https://github.com/thomasvvugt/fiber-boilerplate) - A boilerplate for the Fiber web framework.
*   [sujit-baniya/fiber-boilerplate (‚≠ê424)](https://github.com/sujit-baniya/fiber-boilerplate) - Boilerplate on the top of fiber web framework with many middlewares and features.
*   [create-go-app/fiber-go-template (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/create-go-app/fiber-go-template) - Fiber backend template for Create Go App CLI.
*   [embedmode/fiberseed (‚≠ê40)](https://github.com/embedmode/fiberseed) - Fiber boilerplate api with many middlewares.

### üìÅ Recipes / üå± Third Party

*   [kiyonlin/fiblar-demo (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/kiyonlin/fiblar-demo) - Fiber v1 + angular demo.
*   [koddr/tutorial-go-fiber-rest-api (‚≠ê396)](https://github.com/koddr/tutorial-go-fiber-rest-api) - Tutorial for building a restful api with fiber.
*   [firebase007/go-rest-api-with-fiber (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/firebase007/go-rest-api-with-fiber) - Demo project with fiber, logging, basicAuth and postgresql.
*   [chawk/go\_fiber\_quickstart (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/chawk/go_fiber_quickstart) - Fiber quick start example project.
*   [EricLau1/go-fiber-auth-api (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/EricLau1/go-fiber-auth-api) - Golang Authentication API with Fiber MongoDB and JWT.

### ü§ñ Benchmarks / üå± Third Party

*   [TechEmpower](https://www.techempower.com/benchmarks/#section=data-r20\&hw=ph\&test=json) - Project provides performance measures across a wide field of web application frameworks.
*   [web-frameworks-benchmark](https://web-frameworks-benchmark.netlify.app/result) - Project aims to measure the differences between the various programming language frameworks.
*   [go-web-framework-benchmark (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/smallnest/go-web-framework-benchmark) - This benchmark suite aims to compare the performance of Go web frameworks.
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Osint
items.content_text:
### Social Media Tools / Facebook

*   [Facebook Friend List Scraper (‚≠ê281)](https://github.com/narkopolo/fb_friend_list_scraper) - Tool for scraping large Facebook friend lists without being rate-limited.
items.content_html:
Social Media Tools / Facebook

  • Facebook Friend List Scraper (‚≠ê281) - Tool for scraping large Facebook friend lists without being rate-limited.

items.title: Awesome Quant
items.content_text:
### Python / Trading & Backtesting

*   [zipline (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/quantopian/zipline) - Pythonic algorithmic trading library.

### Python / Data Sources

*   [pystlouisfed (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/TomasKoutek/pystlouisfed) - Python client for Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis API - FRED, ALFRED, GeoFRED and FRASER.
*   [python-bcb (‚≠ê95)](https://github.com/wilsonfreitas/python-bcb) - Python interface to Brazilian Central Bank web services.

### R / Numerical Libraries & Data Structures

*   [xts (‚≠ê220)](https://github.com/joshuaulrich/xts) - eXtensible Time Series: Provide for uniform handling of R's different time-based data classes by extending zoo, maximizing native format information preservation and allowing for user level customization and extension, while simplifying cross-class interoperability.
*   [data.table (‚≠ê3.8k)](https://github.com/Rdatatable/data.table) - Extension of data.frame: Fast aggregation of large data (e.g. 100GB in RAM), fast ordered joins, fast add/modify/delete of columns by group using no copies at all, list columns and a fast file reader (fread). Offers a natural and flexible syntax, for faster development.

### R / Data Sources

*   [Rblpapi (‚≠ê170)](https://github.com/Rblp/Rblpapi) - An R Interface to 'Bloomberg' is provided via the 'Blp API'.
*   [Rbitcoin (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/jangorecki/Rbitcoin) - Unified markets API interface (bitstamp, kraken, btce, bitmarket).
*   [GetTDData (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/msperlin/GetTDData) - Downloads and aggregates data for Brazilian government issued bonds directly from the website of Tesouro Direto.
*   [GetHFData (‚≠ê40)](https://github.com/msperlin/GetHFData) - Downloads and aggregates high frequency trading data for Brazilian instruments directly from Bovespa ftp site.
*   [Reddit WallstreetBets API](https://dashboard.nbshare.io/apps/reddit/api/) - Provides daily top 50 stocks from reddit (subreddit) Wallstreetbets and their sentiments via the API.
*   [td (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/eddelbuettel/td) - Interfaces the 'twelvedata' API for stocks and (digital and standard) currencies.
*   [rbcb (‚≠ê95)](https://github.com/wilsonfreitas/rbcb) - R interface to Brazilian Central Bank web services.

### R / Financial Instruments and Pricing

*   [portfolio (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/dgerlanc/portfolio) - Analysing equity portfolios.
*   [credule (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/blenezet/credule) - Credit Default Swap Functions.
*   [PortfolioAnalytics (‚≠ê93)](https://github.com/braverock/PortfolioAnalytics) - Portfolio Analysis, Including Numerical Methods for Optimizationof Portfolios.
*   [fmbasics (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/imanuelcostigan/fmbasics) - Financial Market Building Blocks.
*   [R-fixedincome (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/wilsonfreitas/R-fixedincome) - Fixed income tools for R.

### R / Trading

*   [TTR (‚≠ê341)](https://github.com/joshuaulrich/TTR) - Technical Trading Rules.

### R / Risk Analysis

*   [PerformanceAnalytics (‚≠ê227)](https://github.com/braverock/PerformanceAnalytics) - Econometric tools for performance and risk analysis.

### R / Time Series

*   [rugarch (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/alexiosg/rugarch) - Univariate GARCH Models.
*   [rmgarch (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/alexiosg/rmgarch) - Multivariate GARCH Models.

### R / Calendars

*   [bizdays (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/wilsonfreitas/R-bizdays) - Business days calculations and utilities

### Julia / FrameWorks

*   [Miletus.jl (‚≠ê89)](https://github.com/JuliaComputing/Miletus.jl) - A financial contract definition, modeling language, and valuation framework.

### Reproducing Works, Training & Books / Data Visualization

*   [Machine-Learning-for-Asset-Managers (‚≠ê559)](https://github.com/emoen/Machine-Learning-for-Asset-Managers) - Implementation of code snippets, exercises and application to live data from Machine Learning for Asset Managers (Elements in Quantitative Finance) written by Prof. Marcos L√≥pez de Prado.
items.content_html:
Python / Trading & Backtesting

  • zipline (‚≠ê19k) - Pythonic algorithmic trading library.

Python / Data Sources

  • pystlouisfed (‚≠ê18) - Python client for Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis API - FRED, ALFRED, GeoFRED and FRASER.
  • python-bcb (‚≠ê95) - Python interface to Brazilian Central Bank web services.

R / Numerical Libraries & Data Structures

  • xts (‚≠ê220) - eXtensible Time Series: Provide for uniform handling of R's different time-based data classes by extending zoo, maximizing native format information preservation and allowing for user level customization and extension, while simplifying cross-class interoperability.
  • data.table (‚≠ê3.8k) - Extension of data.frame: Fast aggregation of large data (e.g. 100GB in RAM), fast ordered joins, fast add/modify/delete of columns by group using no copies at all, list columns and a fast file reader (fread). Offers a natural and flexible syntax, for faster development.

R / Data Sources

  • Rblpapi (‚≠ê170) - An R Interface to 'Bloomberg' is provided via the 'Blp API'.
  • Rbitcoin (‚≠ê57) - Unified markets API interface (bitstamp, kraken, btce, bitmarket).
  • GetTDData (‚≠ê24) - Downloads and aggregates data for Brazilian government issued bonds directly from the website of Tesouro Direto.
  • GetHFData (‚≠ê40) - Downloads and aggregates high frequency trading data for Brazilian instruments directly from Bovespa ftp site.
  • Reddit WallstreetBets API - Provides daily top 50 stocks from reddit (subreddit) Wallstreetbets and their sentiments via the API.
  • td (‚≠ê16) - Interfaces the 'twelvedata' API for stocks and (digital and standard) currencies.
  • rbcb (‚≠ê95) - R interface to Brazilian Central Bank web services.

R / Financial Instruments and Pricing

  • portfolio (‚≠ê16) - Analysing equity portfolios.
  • credule (‚≠ê6) - Credit Default Swap Functions.
  • PortfolioAnalytics (‚≠ê93) - Portfolio Analysis, Including Numerical Methods for Optimizationof Portfolios.
  • fmbasics (‚≠ê12) - Financial Market Building Blocks.
  • R-fixedincome (‚≠ê60) - Fixed income tools for R.

R / Trading

R / Risk Analysis

  • PerformanceAnalytics (‚≠ê227) - Econometric tools for performance and risk analysis.

R / Time Series

  • rugarch (‚≠ê28) - Univariate GARCH Models.
  • rmgarch (‚≠ê14) - Multivariate GARCH Models.

R / Calendars

Julia / FrameWorks

Reproducing Works, Training & Books / Data Visualization

  • Machine-Learning-for-Asset-Managers (‚≠ê559) - Implementation of code snippets, exercises and application to live data from Machine Learning for Asset Managers (Elements in Quantitative Finance) written by Prof. Marcos L√≥pez de Prado.
